abbreviation.label: Short name
abbreviation.sublabel: The abbreviation, acronym, or other common name used for the model.

status.label: What is the status of your Model Plan?

tooltips.ACCOUNTABLE_CARE: Models in which a doctor, group of health care providers or hospital takes financial responsibility for improving quality of care, including advanced primary care services, care coordination and health outcomes for a defined group of patients, thereby reducing care fragmentation and unnecessary costs for patients and the health system
tooltips.DISEASE_SPECIFIC_AND_EPISODIC: Models which aim to address deficits in care for a defined population with a specific shared disease or medical condition, procedure, or care episode
tooltips.PRESCRIPTION_DRUG: Models that seek to improve access to and/or the affordability of prescription drugs covered under Medicare (Part B and D) or Medicaid.
tooltips.STATE_BASED: Models in which a state or community-based organization serves as the main contractual participant, including managed care organizations serving Medicaid beneficiaries.
tooltips.STATUTORY: Models and demonstrations requiring testing as determined by Congress and/or the Secretary of Health and Human Services.

additional_model_categories.label: Additional model categories
additional_model_categories.sublabel: If your model doesn’t fall into any additional categories, you can skip this.

tooltips.ACCOUNTABLE_CARE: Models in which a doctor, group of health care providers or hospital takes financial responsibility for improving quality of care, including advanced primary care services, care coordination and health outcomes for a defined group of patients, thereby reducing care fragmentation and unnecessary costs for patients and the health system
tooltips.DISEASE_SPECIFIC_AND_EPISODIC: Models which aim to address deficits in care for a defined population with a specific shared disease or medical condition, procedure, or care episode
tooltips.PRESCRIPTION_DRUG: Models that seek to improve access to and/or the affordability of prescription drugs covered under Medicare (Part B and D) or Medicaid.
tooltips.STATE_BASED: Models in which a state or community-based organization serves as the main contractual participant, including managed care organizations serving Medicaid beneficiaries.
tooltips.STATUTORY: Models and demonstrations requiring testing as determined by Congress and/or the Secretary of Health and Human Services.

options.CMMI: Center for Medicare and Medicaid Innovation (CMMI)
options.CENTER_FOR_CLINICAL_STANDARDS_AND_QUALIT: Center for Clinical Standards and Quality (CCSQ)
options.CENTER_FOR_MEDICAID_AND_CHIP_SERVICES: Center for Medicaid and CHIP Services (CMCS)

cms_centers.label: CMMI Group
cms_centers.sublabel: You only need to select the CMMI group if CMMI is selected as the main CMS component.

goal.label: Goal
goal.sublabel: Please include the high level goal of the program and a description of the project.

phased_in.label: If timelines are tight, might there be pieces of the model that can be phased in over time?
phased_in.sublabel: That is, the basic model would start at the earliest possible date but additional facets could be phased in at a later quarter.

is_new_model.label: Is this a new track of an existing model or a new model?

options.false: New track of an existing model

existing_model.label: Which existing model?
existing_model.sublabel: Start typing the name of the model

resembles_existing_model.label: Does your proposed track/model resemble any existing models?

resembles_existing_model_why_how.label: Explain why and how the model made this decision.

resembles_existing_model_which.label: Which existing models does your proposed track/model most closely resemble?
resembles_existing_model_which.sublabel: Start typing the name of the model

resembles_existing_model_how.label: In what way does the new model resemble the selected model(s)?

participation_in_model_precondition.label: Is participation in another model a precondition for participation in this model?

participation_in_model_precondition_whic.label: Which models?
participation_in_model_precondition_whic.sublabel: Start typing the name of the model

participation_in_model_precondition_why_.label: Explain any details including if it is just part of the model.

has_components_or_tracks.label: Are there different components/tracks?
has_components_or_tracks.readonlyLabel: Are there different components/tracks? If so, how do the tracks differ?

agency_or_state_help.label: Will another Agency or State help design/operate the model? Select all that apply.
agency_or_state_help.readonlyLabel: Will another Agency or State help design/operate the model?

options.YES_STATE: Yes, we will partner with states
options.YES_AGENCY_IDEAS: Yes, we will get ideas from another agency
options.YES_AGENCY_IAA: Yes, we will get support from another agency through Inter Agency Agreement (IAA)

alternative_payment_model_types.label: What type of Alternative Payment Model (APM) do you think the model could be?
alternative_payment_model_types.sublabel: In order to be considered by the Quality Payment Program (QPP), and to be MIPS or Advanced APM, you will need to collect TINs and NPIs for providers.

key_characteristics.label: What are the model key characteristics? Select all that apply.
key_characteristics.readonlyLabel: What are the model key characteristics?

key_characteristics_other.label: Please describe the other key characteristics

collect_plan_bids.label: Will you review and collect plan bids?

manage_part_c_d_enrollment.label: Will you manage Part C/D enrollment?

plan_contract_updated.label: Have you updated the plan’s contract?

care_coordination_involved.label: Is care coordination involved?
care_coordination_involved.readonlyLabel: Is care coordination involved? How so?

additional_services_involved.label: Are additional services involved?
additional_services_involved.readonlyLabel: Are additional services involved? How so?

geographies_targeted.label: Is the model targeted at specific geographies?

geographies_targeted_types_other.label: Please specify what the other geography type is.

geographies_targeted_applied_to_other.label: Please specify what the geographies are applied to.

participation_options.label: Does the model offer different options for participation?

agreement_types.label: What is the agreement type?
agreement_types.sublabel: Note: CMMI writes, Office of General Council (OGC) approves both types of agreements

multiple_patricipation_agreements_needed.label: Which rule do you anticipate using and what is the target date of display for that regulation?

rulemaking_required.label: Is rulemaking required?
rulemaking_required.readonlyLabel: Is rulemaking required? If so, which rule do you anticipate using and what is the target date of display for that regulation?

authority_allowances.label: What authority allows CMMI to test the model?

options.SSA_PART_B: Section 1833(e) (Part B services) of the Social Security Act

waivers_required.label: Are waivers required?
waivers_required.readonlyLabel: Are waivers required? If so, which types of waivers?

waivers_required_types.label: Which types of waivers are required? Select all that apply.
waivers_required_types.readonlyLabel: Which types of waivers are required?

optionsLabels.PROGRAM_PAYMENT: (Note: CMMI writes, Office of General Council (OGC) adivses, full clearance process is required)

participants.label: Who are the participants? Select all that apply.

states_engagement.label: Please describe how states will engage with your model.

participantsOther.label: Please describe the other participants engaging with this model

modelApplicationLevel.label: At what level will the model apply?
modelApplicationLevel.sublabel: (e.g., all services identified at the CPT or ICD-10 code level, epsiode of care for a specific span of time, all hospitals unpaid under the Inpatient Prospective Payment System in a certain state)

expected_number_of_participants.label: How many participants do you expect?
expected_number_of_participants.sublabel: Note: Sometimes RRCEG provides a minimum for the power calculation. Other times stakeholder research may inform the team about who are good candidates or might be interested in participating.

estimate_confidence.label: What is your level of confidence on this estimate?

recruitment_method.label: How will you recruit the participants?

options.NOFO: NOFO (Notice of funding opportunity for grants/cooperative agreements)

optionsLabels.NOFO: CMMI writes, Office of General Council (OGC) reviews and approves

selection_method.label: How will you select participants? Select all that appy.

options.APPLICATION_REVIEW_AND_SCORING_TOOL: Use an application review and scoring tool
options.BASIC_CRITERIA: We have a basic set of criteria and plan to accept any participant that meets them
options.CMS_COMPONENT_OR_PROCESS: Another CMS component or process will provide support

selection_other.label: Please describe the other participants engaging with this model

risk_type.label: What type of risk will the participant assume?

will_risk_change.label: Will the risk arrangement change as the model progresses?

coordinate_work.label: Will the participants coordinate the work of others?

gainshare_payments_eligibility.label: Are providers eligible to participate in gainsharing arrangements?

participants_ids.label: Will you collect participant IDs? If so, select which types.
participants_ids.sublabel: Note: If this will be a MIPS or Advanced APM, you need to collect provider TIN-NPIs for participants to benefit from QPP. In addition, CPI vetting needs to be preformed.

options.NO_IDENTIFIERS: No, we will not collect provider identifiers

provider_add_method.label: How will you decide to add providers? Select all that apply.
provider_add_method.sublabel: Please include details on decision points, timing, and implications of adding them to the model in an additional note.
provider_add_method.readonlyLabel: How will you decide to add providers?

options.PROSPECTIVELY: Add prospectively (based on previous year’s interactions)
options.RETROSPECTIVELY: Add retrospectively (once an interaction happens this year)
options.ONLINE_TOOLS: Use online tools to view what types of participant files and data have been uploaded and downloaded

provider_add_method_other.label: Please describe the other method for deciding which providers to add.

provider_leave_method.label: Can providers leave the model? Select all that apply.
provider_leave_method.sublabel: Please include details on decision points, timing, and implications of leaving the model in an additional note.

options.VARIES_BY_TYPE_OF_PROVIDER: It varies by type of provider
options.NOT_ALLOWED_TO_LEAVE: They are not allowed to leave
options.AFTER_A_CERTAIN_WITH_IMPLICATIONS: They can leave after a certain date but there are implications
options.VOLUNTARILY_WITHOUT_IMPLICATIONS: They can leave voluntarily at any time without implications

provider_overlap.label: Will the providers overlap with other models?

options.YES_NEED_POLICIES: Yes, we expect to develop policies to manage the overlaps
options.YES_NO_ISSUES: Yes, and the overlaps would not be an issue

provider_overlap_hierarchy.label: If model providers can be in multiple models that may interact, please note the desired hierarchy of how any payment changes or edits should be applied.

beneficiaries.label: Who are the beneficiaries of this model? Select all that apply.
beneficiaries.readonlyLabel: Who are the beneficiaries of this model?

optionsLabels.DISEASE_SPECIFIC: (based on a diagnosis, procedure code, condition, etc.)

disease_specific_group.label: Please describe the disease-specific groups this model will impact.

exclude_certain_characteristics.label: Should beneficiaries with certain characteristics or enrollments be excluded?
exclude_certain_characteristics.readonlyLabel: Should beneficiaries with certain characteristics or enrollments be excluded? How so, what are the exclusionary criteria?

number_people_impacted.label: How many people do you think will be impacted by this model?

estimate_confidence.label: What is your level of confidence on this estimate?

beneficiary_selection_method.label: How will you choose beneficiaries? Select all that apply.

options.PROVIDER_SIGN_UP: Beneficiary will sign up through their provider

beneficiary_selection_other.label: Please describe the other method for choosing beneficiaries.

beneficiary_overlap.label: Will the beneficiaries overlap with other models?

options.YES_NEED_POLICIES: Yes, we expect to develop policies to manage the overlaps
options.YES_NO_ISSUES: Yes, and the overlaps would not be an issue

precedence_rules.label: Are there precedence rules between this model and other model(s)?
precedence_rules.sublabel: i.e. other models have precedence over you (e.g. mandatory or statutory models running at the same time as yours)

stakeholders.label: Please describe the other stakeholders you plan to communicate with.

stakeholders_note.label: Do you plan to use a helpdesk?

contractor_support.label: What contractors will support your model?

options.MULTIPLE: May have separate contractors for different implementation functions
options.NONE: Do not plan to use an implemenation contractor

contractor_support_how.label: In what capacity will they support your model?

iddoc_support.label: Are you planning to use IDDOC support?
iddoc_support.sublabel: IDDOC is commonly known as ACO-OS (Accountable Care Organization Operating System). They can provide support for design, development, operations, and maintenance.

uat_needs.label: User Acceptance Testing (UAT) – test data needs

data_monitoring_file_types.label: What types of files? Select all that apply.

eft_set_up.label: Are Electronic File Transfer (EFT) and connectivity set up?

produce_benefit_enhancement_files.label: Will you produce Benefit Enhancement Files?
produce_benefit_enhancement_files.sublabel: This means we would use these files for Participating and Preferred Providers.

benchmark_for_performance.label: Will you establish a benchmark to capture performance?

options.YES_RECONCILE: Yes, and we will reconcile actual performance against it
options.YES_NO_RECONCILE: Yes, but we will not reconcile actual performance against it

risk_adjust_performance.label: Performance Scores
risk_adjust_performance.readonlyLabel: Will you make risk adjustments to performance scores?

risk_adjust_feedback.label: Feedback Results
risk_adjust_feedback.readonlyLabel: Will you make risk adjustments to feedback results?

risk_adjust_payments.label: Payments
risk_adjust_payments.readonlyLabel: Will you make risk adjustments to payments?

risk_adjust_other.label: Others
risk_adjust_other.readonlyLabel: Will you make risk adjustments to others?

appeal_performance.label: Performance Scores
appeal_performance.readonlyLabel: Will participants be able to appeal performance scores?

appeal_feedback.label: Feedback Results
appeal_feedback.readonlyLabel: Will participants be able to appeal feedback results?

appeal_payments.label: Payments
appeal_payments.readonlyLabel: Will participants be able to appeal payments?

appeal_other.label: Others
appeal_other.readonlyLabel: Will participants be able to appeal others?

evaluation_approaches.label: What type of evaluation approach are you considering? Select all that apply.
evaluation_approaches.readonlyLabel: What type of evaluation approach are you considering?

options.NON_MEDICARE_DATA: Leverage non-Medicare data (such as Medicaid data, external data sets)

evaluation_approach_other.label: Please describe the other evaluation approach you are considering.

ccm_involvment.label: Is Chronic Conditions Warehouse (CCW) involved in the model?
ccm_involvment.sublabel: If you select either yes option, there will be additional questions to answer.

data_needed_for_monitoring.label: What data do you need to monitor the model? Select all that apply.
data_needed_for_monitoring.readonlyLabel: What data do you need to monitor the model?
data_needed_for_monitoring.sublabel: If you select quality claims-based measures or quality reported measures, there will be additional questions to answer.

data_needed_for_monitoring_other.label: What other data do you need to monitor?

data_to_send_particicipants.label: What data will you send to participants? Select all that apply.
data_to_send_particicipants.readonlyLabel: What data will you send to participants?

data_to_send_particicipants_other.label: What other data do you need to send?

share_cclf_data.label: Does the model require that identifiable Claim and Claim Line Feed (CCLFs) data need to be shared with participants?

send_files_between_ccw.label: Will you need to send files between the CCW and other applications?

app_to_send_files_to_known.label: Do you know which applications will be on the other sides of the file transfers?
app_to_send_files_to_known.readonlyLabel: Do you know which applications will be on the other sides of the file transfers? If so, please specify.

use_ccw_for_file_distribiution_to_partic.label: Will you use the CCW to distribute files to and from model participants?

develop_new_quality_measures.label: Do you plan to develop a new validated quality measure for your model?

data_sharing_starts.label: Data sharing starts
data_sharing_starts.sublabel: If using ACO-OS support, SSM request to begin analysis at least 1 year before implementation
data_sharing_starts.readonlyHeader: Data sharing, collection, and reporting timing and frequency

options.EARLY_IN_THE_FIRST_PERFORMANCE_YEAR: Early in the first performance year
options.LATER_IN_THE_FIRST_PERFORMANCE_YEAR: Later in the first performance year
options.AT_SOME_OTHER_POINT_IN_TIME: At some other point in time

data_sharing_frequency.label: How often do you anticipate sharing data?

options.EARLY_IN_THE_FIRST_PERFORMANCE_YEAR: Early in the first performance year
options.LATER_IN_THE_FIRST_PERFORMANCE_YEAR: Later in the first performance year
options.AT_SOME_OTHER_POINT_IN_TIME: At some other point in time

data_collection_frequency.label: How often do you anticipate collecting data?

options.EARLY_IN_THE_FIRST_PERFORMANCE_YEAR: Early in the first performance year
options.LATER_IN_THE_FIRST_PERFORMANCE_YEAR: Later in the first performance year
options.AT_SOME_OTHER_POINT_IN_TIME: At some other point in time

quality_reporting_frequency.label: How frequently does quality reporting happen?

model_learning_systems.label: Will the model have a learning strategy?

options.LEARNING_CONTRACTOR: We plan to have a learning contractor (cross-model or individual)
options.IT_PLATFORM_CONNECT: We plan to use an IT platform (Connect)
options.PARTICIPANT_COLLABORATION: We plan to enable participant-to-participant collaboration
options.NO_LEARNING_SYSTEM: No, we will not have a learning strategy

anticipated_challenges.label: What challenges do you anticipate during Model design and implementation?
anticipated_challenges.sublabel: Please list and known ’unknowns,’ that is, are there policy decisions that you are aware of that are still pending or are subject to change? If so, please list to the best of your ability.

funding_source.label: What will be the funding source for payments? Select all that apply.
funding_source.readonlyLabel: What will be the funding source for payments?

tooltips.MEDICARE_PART_A_HI_TRUST_FUND: Also known as the Hospital Insurance (HI) Trust Fund, this covers inpatient hospital care, skilled nursing facility care, home healthcare, and hospice care.
tooltips.MEDICARE_PART_B_SMI_TRUST_FUND: Also known as the Supplementary Medical Insurance (SMI) Trust Fund, this covers physician services, outpatient care, medical supplies, preventive services, and other healthcare services not covered by Part A.

funding_source_r.label: What is the funding source for reconciliation or other expenditures? Select all that apply.
funding_source_r.readonlyLabel: What is the funding source for reconciliation or other expenditures?

tooltips.MEDICARE_PART_A_HI_TRUST_FUND: Also known as the Hospital Insurance (HI) Trust Fund, this covers inpatient hospital care, skilled nursing facility care, home healthcare, and hospice care.
tooltips.MEDICARE_PART_B_SMI_TRUST_FUND: Also known as the Supplementary Medical Insurance (SMI) Trust Fund, this covers physician services, outpatient care, medical supplies, preventive services, and other healthcare services not covered by Part A.

pay_recipients.label: Who will you pay? Select all that apply.

pay_recipients_other_specification.label: Please specify who you will pay.

pay_type.label: What will you pay?
pay_type.sublabel: If you select claims-based payments or non-claims-based payments, there will be additional questions to answer.

pay_claims.label: Select which claims-based payments will you pay.
pay_claims.sublabel: If you select reductions to beneficiary cost-sharing or other, there will be additional questions to answer.

options.CARE_MANAGEMENT_HOME_VISITS: Payments for care management home visits
options.SERVICES_NOT_COVERED_THROUGH_TRADITIONAL: Payments for services not covered through Traditional Medicare
options.SNF_CLAIMS_WITHOUT_3DAY_HOSPITAL_ADMISSI: Payments for SNF claims without 3-day hospital admissions
options.TELEHEALTH_SERVICES_NOT_TRADITIONAL_MEDI: Payments for telehealth services not covered through Traditional Medicare

pay_claims_other.label: Please describe the other claims-based payments you will pay

should_any_providers_excluded_ffs_system.label: Should any model providers be excluded from existing Fee-for-Service payment systems?

changes_medicare_physician_fee_schedule.label: Will the model change the Medicare Physician Fee Schedule?
changes_medicare_physician_fee_schedule.sublabel: If so, it might impact Critical Access Hospitals paid under Method II.

affects_medicare_secondary_payer_claims.label: Does the model affect Medicare Secondary Payer claims?
affects_medicare_secondary_payer_claims.readonlyLabel: Does the model affect Medicare Secondary Payer claims? How so?

pay_model_differentiation.label: How does the model differ from current policy, especially in terms of payment rates and periodicity of payment?

creating_dependencies_between_services.label: Are you anticipating creating dependencies between services?
creating_dependencies_between_services.sublabel: Examples: Service B cannot be paid until Service A has been paid; Service A cannot be paid without Diagnosis 1; If a certain service or diagnosis exists in history, then Service A cannot be paid.

needs_claims_data_collection.label: Will any additional data need to be collected for claims?
needs_claims_data_collection.sublabel: If you are not sure what current data is collected via provider billing, please ask Provider Billing Group (PBG)

providing_third_party_file.label: Will your contractor be providing data (a Third Party File) that will be used in claims processing?

non_claims_payments.label: Select which non-claims-based payments will you pay.

options.MAPD_SHARED_SAVINGS: Medicare Advantage Prescription Drug (MAPD) Shared Savings

non_claims_payments_other.label: Please describe the other non-claims-based payments you will pay.

payment_calculation_owner.label: Who will calculate the non-claims based payments?

number_payments_per_pay_cycle.label: Number of payments per payment cycle
number_payments_per_pay_cycle.sublabel: This only applies if you are making non-claims-based payments

shared_systems_involved_additional_claim.label: Will the Shared Systems be involved for additional payment of claims?

planning_to_use_innovation_payment_contr.label: Are you planning to use the Innovation Payment Contractor?
planning_to_use_innovation_payment_contr.sublabel: Note: If there will be 30+ payees we recommend a contractor.

expected_calculation_complexity_level.label: What level of complexity do you expect calculations to be?

claims_processing_precedence.label: Are there any business requirement(s) that address claims processing precedence order with the other model(s)?
claims_processing_precedence.readonlyLabel: Are there any business requirement(s) that address claims processing precedence order with the other model(s)? If so, please specify.

can_participants_select_between_payment_.label: Will participants be allowed to select between multiple payment mechanisms?
can_participants_select_between_payment_.readonlyLabel: Will participants be allowed to select between multiple payment mechanisms? If so, please describe.

anticipated_payment_frequency.label: How often do you anticipate making payments?

anticipate_reconciling_payments_retrospe.label: Do you anticipate reconciling payments retrospectively?

payment_demand_recoupment_frequency.label: How frequently do you anticipate making demands/recoupments?

payment_start_date.label: When will payments start? (Enter an approximate date)
payment_start_date.sublabel: Note: If you are unsure of an approximate date, please select the first day of the approximate month.
